attributes.description: Indicates the composite material strength and structural durability of the flap panel under aerodynamic loads.

designScenario.description: The Flap System is dedicated to enhancing the aerodynamic performance of a passenger airplane by adjusting lift and drag during takeoff, landing, and high-lift operations at low speeds. The system converts electrical control inputs into precise mechanical flap movements, leveraging rapid actuation and robust material properties. It is designed to perform under extreme environmental conditions, maintain high precision in deflection, and incorporate fail-safe mechanisms to ensure continuous and safe operation.
designScenario.name: Flap System

details.description: Accurately translate actuator commands into precise flap deflections to adjust lift generation during different flight phases.
Ensure controlled angular movement within specified limits to optimize aerodynamic performance.
Achieve flap deflection in less than 50 milliseconds following control command input to ensure timely aerodynamic adjustments.
Minimize actuation delays to enable rapid response to flight control inputs.
Implement redundant mechanical linkages and integrated sensor feedback to monitor flap position and prevent over-deflection.
Ensure the system enters a fail-safe mode during sensor or actuator failures to maintain aircraft safety.
Construct the Flap System with corrosion-resistant materials and coatings to ensure long-term durability in harsh environmental conditions.
Facilitate routine maintenance with a modular design enabling quick replacement of degraded components.

relationships.description: The Actuator Module within the Flap System receives command signals from the central Actuator Control Module, ensuring synchronized and precise flap movements.
The Flap Assembly aggregates multiple subcomponents such as the Flap Panel, Hinge Assembly, and Support Brackets to form the cohesive mechanical structure.
relationships.target: Flap Panel, Hinge Assembly, Support Brackets

relationships.description: The Sensor Unit is composed within the Actuator Module to provide real-time feedback on flap position and motion, ensuring precise control.

systemComponents.description: The primary mechanical assembly that forms the structural basis of the Flap System, responsible for modulating aerodynamic forces during critical flight phases.
systemComponents.name: Flap Assembly

subComponents.description: The main flap panel that interacts directly with aerodynamic flows to generate variable lift and drag.
subComponents.name: Flap Panel

subComponents.description: A robust hinge assembly that enables precise angular motion and secure attachment of the flap panel.
subComponents.name: Hinge Assembly

subComponents.description: Support brackets that distribute loads and ensure structural integrity of the flap assembly during high aerodynamic stresses.
subComponents.name: Support Brackets

systemComponents.description: The subsystem responsible for converting electrical command signals into mechanical motion for flap deflection, ensuring rapid and accurate actuation.
systemComponents.name: Actuator Module

subComponents.description: An electric motor that drives the actuation mechanism with high response speed.
subComponents.name: Electric Motor

subComponents.description: A hydraulic or pneumatic actuation unit that assists in translating motor output into physical flap movement.
subComponents.name: Hydraulic Actuation Unit

systemComponents.description: A sensor package integrated into the flap system to monitor deflection angles and provide feedback for closed-loop control.
systemComponents.name: Sensor Unit

subComponents.description: An angle sensor that accurately measures the deflection angle of the flap.
subComponents.name: Angle Sensor

subComponents.description: A position sensor that monitors the absolute position of the flap to ensure correct alignment.
subComponents.name: Position Sensor
